ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Multiple Sclerosis
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Patient has a confirmed diagnosis of MS; ABR findings of delayed waves III and V in the right ear correlate with MRI findings of a plaque in the right low pons.

ordered_list.rationale_short: Assess peripheral hearing sensitivity given vague auditory complaints.
Evaluate speech recognition ability in quiet.
Assess integrity of higher auditory areas and interhemispheric transfer.
Evaluate brainstem function due to neurological history and symptoms.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient demonstrates normal peripheral hearing sensitivity and excellent speech recognition. However, ABR testing reveals retrocochlear pathology in the right ear, characterized by delayed neural conduction times (Waves III and V) and extended interwave intervals, which correlates with the MRI finding of a demyelinating plaque in the right pons.

tests.name: Auditory Brainstem Response (ABR)
tests.result_summary: Left Ear: Normal latencies. Right Ear: Normal Wave I, but significantly delayed Wave III (5.0 ms) and Wave V (7.0 ms). Extended I-III (3.2 ms) and I-V (5.28 ms) intervals. Abnormal Interaural Latency Difference (1 ms).

tests.name: MRI
tests.result_summary: Large plaque located at the right posterio-lateral surface of the brainstem (low pons), likely compromising the right dorsal cochlear nucleus.

counseling_actions: Explain that normal peripheral hearing tests account for good sensitivity in quiet
Discuss ABR results indicating a slowdown of the nerve signal in the brainstem on the right side
Correlate auditory findings with the known MS diagnosis and MRI plaque location
Advise monitoring for changes in speech understanding in noise

escalation.rationale_short: Auditory findings confirm central involvement consistent with known MS diagnosis; continued management by neurology is appropriate.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor for any changes in auditory processing or speech understanding in noise.
